Commentary: full into middle, flicks it through midwicket
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Rahul, 2 runs

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Rahul, no run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, better lines from Taskin, Rahul evades it again
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Rahul, no run

Commentary: plays on! He goes for a drive through cover, seeing a full ball outside off, but it's a pretty loose shot. The footwork isn't there. The weight is on his back foot. Only the hands go into the shot and an inside edge results so that Taskin can exult
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Rahul, OUT
Dismissal_text: KL Rahul  b Taskin Ahmed 2 (3m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

Commentary: 143 kph, hints of inswing for Taskin as he pitches it up. Pujara is late into his defensive push, and gets an inside edge onto pad
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: decks back in off a grassy pitch at 141 kph, Pujara, on the back foot, defends carefully
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, Vijay moves across towards the line and then leaves the ball
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: watchful, as he needs to be early in a Test match and though this is a short delivery outside off, the kind that's cut through the line for four, Vijay avoids it
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: gets forward to a fuller ball on off stump, but ends up having to adjust to the ball nipping back in off the pitch.
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: the shorter length is easier to deal with, as expected on a pitch with some juice in it for the quicks, early at least. Vijay defends
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: nudges a back of a length delivery off his hips towards midwicket
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: into the backfoot cover drive a bit too early, and therefore is playing too far in front of his body against this short ball outside off. Inside edge to midwicket
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: 143 kph, back of a length and outside off, Pujara leaves, and watches the ball carry through nicely to the wicketkeeper
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: strong stride forward to a 143 kph pitched-up delivery outside off and defends it with bat close to pad
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: tucks him up with a short delivery, coming up towards his armpits at 136 kph, Pujara defuses it to short leg
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: yards of daylight between bat and pad and yet there is an appeal for caught behind from the cordon. Taskin looks absolutely bemused. He knows he lost his line with this shortish delivery down leg. Pujara chooses not to play
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: inswing again, Pujara reads it, plays with it, gently past midwicket. That was 90 mph from Taskin, 145-plus kph
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, 2 runs

Commentary: gets up off his toes to make sure he is on top of a shortish delivery on middle and leg. Bunts it down
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: the slingy action doesn't affect his ability to get swing. The seam is angled towards the slips, and it swings so late. Vijay manages to put bat to it. But he wasn't necessarily comfortable
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: digs it in short immediately after a full ball that made him play away from the body. Good bowling from Rabbi. Vijay picks up the length early and ducks
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Vijay ignores it
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: great timing from Vijay. All he does is lean into a push past point with an angled bat. Two runs off a pretty good ball, on a length and just outside off
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, 2 runs

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, with a little swing away, Vijay lets it pass
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: short, wide, asking to be hit and Vijay is all about to oblige before a few alarm bells ring in his head. Not sure why though, if he had hit it hard and then connected with an edge, it would have easily gone over the slips. Anyway, another leave alone
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: another 90 mph delivery from Taskin, pitching short and outside off. Pujara is capably behind it
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: good work from Mominul at short leg, getting behind a flick from Pujara and flicking the ball at the stumps to make sure he hurries back
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: fuller delivery on off stump, tinged with inswing, Pujara defends
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: gets the ball to rise up towards Pujara's throat, and only his soft hands save him. Hits the shoulder of the bat, and he has to take the bottom hand off to control it. Single behind short leg
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: top delivery again, this at 144 kph, all this pace is exceedingly useful when you pitch it short and make the ball jag into the right-hander, off the pitch. Vijay does very well, dropping his wrists and swaying away
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Vijay, no run

Commentary: 143 kph, excellent length again, after a couple of short ones, he goes for a good length ball outside off, looking ofr the outside edge, in case Vijay is lead-footed. He isn't. Good leave
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Vijay, no run

Commentary: is he a touch early on the shot? He goes down low to drive a full and wide delivery, and checks his shot as if he isn't entirely comfortable hitting through the line
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: that's a weakness of his, the full ball on the stumps, but Pujara does well, playing close to the body and turning the bat face only on impact for a single to midwicket
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: goes for the short one, but it strays down leg. Easy sighter
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: good bouncer again, on off stump, rising towards his shoulder, hits Vijay on the bottom hand as he gets up tall to defend. Top bowling, but Vijay still gets a single. Bangladesh fielders need to be better in keeping one batsman on strike
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, 1 run

Commentary: chancy! Pujara goes for a square drive, away from the body, and a little away swing makes him lose control of the shot a little bit. Gets most of the outside half of the bat for a boundary past gully
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, FOUR runs

Commentary: fuller delivery on off stump, gets forward to block
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: roll of the wrists to send an overpitched delivery down towards the long-on boundary. Terrible work by the man at mid-on. Dives right over the ball and lets it through
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Vijay, 3 runs

Commentary: waits on the shortish delivery outside off and guides it to gully
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: ooh, lots of things happen there, and it all begins with a little inswing. Pujara goes for a flick to work with it, but he still gets a leading edge towards point. Wants to get off strike, but this time his partner says no. He's halfway down, on those wonky knees, and has to hurry back
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, steers it square of the wicket on the off side
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: shortish on middle and leg, lets it come on and dabs to long leg
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: plays early again, and it's Pujara's turn to deny the batsman a single off a leading edge. This is a length delivery though, Vijay playing with a closed face, looking for midwicket. Taijul at cover point has had a busy over
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Vijay, 1 run

Commentary: no feet, all hands, the crack of the inside edge is loud and a source of anguish for the bowler. Rabbi throws his head back, wishing for one of those to canon into the stumps
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, 1 run

Commentary: doesn't carry to the man at short leg, there is glove on this fend against a short ball on middle. Superb direction, superb bowling. But Bangladesh's fielders are in the wrong place. On a slow pitch, it seems Mominul is standing too deep
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: gets up off his toes and nudges it behind square leg. More short-pitched bowling, at the body
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: 141kph, full on off stump, but it is still just the right kind of ball, Vijay might as well say, to flick to midwicket. Languid wrists
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: shortish on off stump, blocks
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: 134kph, bangs it in, Vijay goes for the pull, gets just enough on it for a boundary to long leg. Not entirely controlled
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, FOUR runs

Commentary: good length ball, veers away in the air, but since it is outside off stump, the batsman can leave it
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: gets forward but hides his bat behind pad, respecting a good length ball that curls away in the air. Bangladesh are not giving anything away
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: good length ball outside off, Pujara doesn't bother with it. There's still enough wobble around, so much that Mushfiqur, who has only recently recovered from a finger injury, struggles with it behind the stumps. Tough cricket so far and we're not done with the first hour
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: short and wide, rather tame delivery, but Pujara chooses to be safe than sorry and leaves
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: stays beside a shortish delivery angled in at off stump, defends
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, no run

Commentary: waits on the back foot, tickles the back of a length ball around the corner behind square leg
Commentary_short: Taskin Ahmed to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, gets forward to block. Hits the bat reasonably high
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: falls short of first slip. Gorgeous delivery from Rabbi, getting it to away so late. Pujara is totally deceived, pushing forward to block with hard hands. Think the keeper should have gone for it. Slip was moving to his left, and it was dying on him too
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: good length ball outside off, defends
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: good length ball, with some away movement, Pujara doesn't want any part of it

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, no shot offered
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Pujara, no run

Commentary: a touch too straight and all Pujara has to do is wait, and then flick it to long leg with a roll of the wrists

Commentary: full and wide, with a little curl away, Pujara doesn't need to do much

Commentary: good length ball, on and around fifth stump, Pujara gets forward and watches it shimmy past

Commentary: fuller delivery on off stump, pushes it back to the bowler

Commentary: good length ball outside off, ignores it

Commentary: beautiful strike! This four is made by the angle of the bat, and how it isn't as closed. And those small margins were necessary because this is a decent delivery, full on middle. Pujara though just leans over it, and flicks between midwicket and mid-on

Commentary: shortish and outside off, but there isn't as much pace on the pitch, as evidenced by another inside edge. This time Vijay is on the back foot, looking to force a drive through cover

Commentary: doesn't move his feet much, as he goes for a push into the covers. Mahmudullah in the covers flings in a throw at the batsman's end, there is no one backing up

Commentary: pulls to long leg. His line goes awry, and the short ball comes up only at the hip as well. Into his sixth over now, could be why he's missed his mark

Commentary: covers the line of this back of a length delivery on off stump, defends
Commentary_short: Kamrul Islam Rabbi to Vijay, no run

Commentary: good shot. Stays in line with a short ball, rising just over the stomach. His hands are over the ball, the wrists roll on top of it and the timing is perfect. The one-legged pull through square leg. Majestic

Commentary: good length ball outside off, Vijay shoulders arms and then practices a square drive. That's the first hour done. Bangladesh's quicks have done well to deserve a bit of drinks

Commentary: comes down the track to the second ball he faces off Mehedi and blocks

Commentary: tosses it up just outside off, he gets to the pitch and blocks

Commentary: they've muffed up an easy run-out. Rabbi at square leg does well in the first place to create the uncertainty, diving to his left, but then his throw is only lobbed to the bowler, and it comes on the half-volley to Mehedi, in front of the stumps, who can't collect it. Vijay is safe, and gets a single for his backfoot flick, after looking all at sea. Pujara had taken off for a run like a horse bolting, not realising his partner was nowhere near ready. Vijay even shapes to get back in his crease but by then Pujara was past him and the only option he has is to commit
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Vijay, 1 run
Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Pujara, 1 run

Commentary: but he's gone right after the record, trying to defend, gets a thick outside edge, which hits the top flap of the wicketkeeper's pad and jumps up for him to have a second grab. Musfiqur has the presence of mind to watch it all the way as he dives to his right

Commentary: bowled around the legs! Poor execution of the lap sweep. A touch too full for the shot in the first place, but having made the move to plant his front leg outside off to avoid lbw, and get into the position he needs to play off the stumps, he does not make any connection. That means the ball has a free path to skip along and hit middle. Top innings from Vijay, bit of a silly end though.
Commentary_short: Taijul Islam to Vijay, OUT

Commentary: taken at short cover! Magnificent effort from Mehedi, rushing to his left, diving full-length, and I think he picks it up behind him. Rahane plays away from his body, and is surprised by a little turn and bounce. There's even a puff of dust. No celebrations from Bangladesh. The bowler, Taijul just looks expressionless. The catcher, Mehedi, just put his head down in relief for having clung on
Commentary_short: Taijul Islam to Rahane, OUT
Dismissal_text: AM Rahane c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Taijul Islam 82 (200m 133b 11x4 0x6) SR: 61.65

Commentary: another huge appeal for lbw, and umpire Wilson gives it. Kohli's gone! But wait, he's reviewed it. This is a tossed up delivery, outside off, he comes forward, looking to flick towards mid-on. The impact is on off stump, the turn is sharp, should be missing leg stump and is. Kohli survives. Hyderabad roars. The Bangladesh fans wilt
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Kohli, no run

Commentary: misses a stumping. Saha is so far out of the crease, this should've been straightforward. Finally the bowlers are doing their bit to make the batsman make mistakes. And the fielders are just not backing them up. This time Mushfiqur is just too far behind the stumps for his hands to reach them. He misses the stumping first, misses a second time too, and by the time he eventually breaks the stumps, Saha is back

Great effort from Tamim, the fielder, diving headlong after the ball, but he is unable to prevent the ball's progress

Commentary: he's lbw, Kohli walks off. Doesn't bother reviewing because he knows this is pad first. Been trying to late cut fuller deliveries on off stump for a while now. And the risk catches up with him. Tajiul gets in the quicker delivery, on the right length, doesn't lose the pace after pitching, which could have saved the batsman. One of the few mistakes in a nearly flawless innings. But wait, replays indicate the impact with the pad is outside the off stump. Didn't look it on first sight, and that's all umpire Erasmus had
Commentary_short: Taijul Islam to Kohli, OUT

This is tossed up, onto off stump, the batsman plays across the line, gets hit low on the front pad. 'Looks like no bat there,' says third umpire Gaffaney. Nothing on Ultra-Edge either. Umpire's call on impact, just enough of the ball is outside off stump on impact and Saha survives

Commentary: full and outside off, drives past cover's left

Commentary: good length ball outside off, steers it to backward point

Commentary: goes after the wide ball, and manages to mis-hit it in front of and over point. Jadeja runs after it, but he has too much distance to cover from backward point.

Commentary: moves back over the stumps now for a good length ball on off stump and blocks

Commentary: goes for a flick against a good length ball that is moving across him. Bit of a leading edge back down the pitch

Commentary: plants his front leg on off stump and plays around it - he can do that on a slow pitch, he has the time, and where the ball doesn't dart around. Single to square leg

Commentary: fuller deliveyr outside off, drives to the left of cover
Commentary_short: Kumar to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, drives to point

Commentary: length ball outside off, slides it off the open face to point

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, dabs it towards cover

Commentary_short: Ashwin to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: fuller delivery on middle and off, keeps it out

Commentary: this one goes on with the arm, having pitched on a good length on off stump. Sarkar goes back to flick, gets a deflection off the pads to fine leg

Commentary: lobs it up onto the base of middle stump, Tamim makes room and lashes it to cover
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: 141kph, back of a length on middle, blocks
Commentary_short: Yadav to Soumya Sarkar, no run

Commentary: whoa! This is a 142 kph jaffa, and India believe they have a caught behind. Go for a review. Magnificent ball first up from Umesh, pitching fullish on off stump, and swinging in between the bat and pad. Too quick for Sarkar's defences as he comes forward with a lazy drive on the up towards mid-off. UltraEdge says there's a bottom edge and Sarkar's gone. Seems like this review came out of the confidence of Pujara at mid-on, saying there was a nick, and Vijay as well at midwicket. Kohli at cover also seems to have heard something. Saha, the keeper, didn't even appeal. He just did the other most important thing, diving low to his right to pick up the catch.
Commentary_short: Yadav to Soumya Sarkar, OUT
Dismissal_text: Soumya Sarkar c †Saha b Yadav 15 (54m 31b 3x4 0x6) SR: 48.38

Commentary: lobs up a full toss outside off, which he drives to cover
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: shortish on middle and leg, he tries a flick but gets hit on the pad
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Mominul looks to defend, but the ball straightens down the line and beats him

Commentary: finishes with a short ball, on target, making Mominul shuffle across onto the off side and fend it away behind short leg. End of a top over from India's fastest bowler

Commentary: tosses it up onto off stump, Tamim pushes hard at the ball and gets an inside edge down the pitch

Commentary: nudges a fuller delivery on off stump, nudges into the leg side

Commentary: tosses it up on off stump, defends
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: moves back in line with all three stumps and the length ball that keeps coming on with the arm takes the inside edge into the square leg region. Ashwin thought he had his man lbw

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, lets it go
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: there's a deflection as the ball passes the bat, but there's no edge. This is reverse swing from Umesh in the 14th over. Good length ball, wide of off stump, drawing Tamim into the stroke and beating him.

Commentary: 145kph, slings in the yorker at the toes of Tamim, digs it out

Commentary: goes short and outside off, the batsman ducks under it

Commentary: back of a length and just outside off, Tamim finds a single in front of point

Commentary: fullish on the stumps, Mominul pushes to mid-on and gets a quick single to end the day

Commentary: good length ball, deviating towards the shine, but not so much that the batsman will be worried. Mominul reads the line to be outside off and shoulders arms

Commentary: pitches on a good length on the off stump and angles it across the left-hander, bowling over the wicket, Mominul ignores it

Commentary: on the pads, looking to generate enough outswing to square Mominul up. Not this time. The batsman nudges it into the leg side with a straight bat

Commentary: whoa is the shout from behind the wicket as Bhuvi makes the third-day pitch deliver some extra bounce. It's a back of a length ball, outside off, Mominul does well not to commit to any shot and then get out of the way
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: that's top notch! The intention, by way of the angle of the seam, is to move the ball into the left-hander. It's pointed to the right of the wicketkeeper. But the shine is towards the slips. And it goes with the shine, hitting back of a length, seaming away off the deck. Since it is in line with middle and off, Mominul has to play, and he tries to with a block. Comfortably beaten
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: teases the drive as a follow-up, Mominul, having put that last ball behind him, leaves
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Tamim pulls the bat inside the line
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: into the pads on a full length and Tamim clips it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: gets an outside edge, and though he does push at the ball, it doesn't carry to KL Rahul at second slip. Good bowling from Umesh, in the off stump corridor, making the batsman play, and getting it to seam away just late enough to make the mistake
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: attempts a slice behind point, but he is quite uncertain, worried about the movement off the pitch. Gets a bottom edge
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: works it off his hips behind square leg, that's easy to do against a bowler angling the ball into you from around the stumps
Commentary_short: Yadav to Tamim Iqbal, 1 leg bye

Commentary: he's a touch early into his straight-bat push, but realises his mistake and softens the grip he has on his bat. So a full delivery, curling away in the air, not much but just enough, takes the outside edge through point all along the ground

Commentary: 136kph, back of a length and outside off, Mominul is well aware of his stumps and knows this poses no threat to them
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: goes wider outside off to see if Mominul might perceive it as a scoring opportunity and therefore offer the chance of his outside edge. The batsman refuses to play again
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: good length, pitching and darting away off the seam, Mominul covers the line and then sticks the bat high into the air
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: there isn't a two there, but they go for it and Tamim is run-out at the non-strikers. He throws his partner a forlorn look. Bangladesh did not need this. And to think all this began with a good shot. Mominul has made the bowler bowl at him, into his body, which meant he can flick it behind square leg. Umesh runs in from the boundary, gets to it quickly enough and realises that has given second thoughts to the two batsmen in the middle. Mominul and Tamim, who were jogging across for a single, go for the another run and just stop midway, staring at each other. Then they set off again and by that time the flat throw is into the bowler, Bhuvneshwar collects it cleanly and does the rest
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, 1 run, OUT

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, nudges it into the leg side
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: moves around the stumps for a back of a length delivery outside off, defends towards point

Commentary: good length ball outside off, Mahmudullah seems to poke at the ball but is nowhere close to the line of it

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, offers no shot

Commentary: squares him up with a good length ball, tinged with away movement. Mahmudullah, by virtue of playing late, is able to block it

Commentary: bangs it in short, the batsman ducks under it

Commentary: now goes for the inswing. India are trusting their fast bowlers in the first hour and they are delivering. This is pitched on a good length, curls in the air, gains further movement off the pitch. Mahmudullah covers his off stump and leaves outside it

Commentary: starts with a short one at 128 kph, Mominul gets under it

Commentary: shortish, into the body, Mominul works it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mominul Haque, no run

Commentary: that's good. Show the full face of the bat. This is a full ball that is drilled back at the bowler

Commentary: goes for the pull, and just about gets it over the fielder at midwicket. Good effort from Pujara, leaping up, sticking his right hand up to try and drag it down. Mominul has timed it just well enough to collect a boundary

Commentary: cramps him up with a short ball, which is much quicker. Mominul is stuck in the crease, playing across the line and takes a blow to the body

Commentary: good length ball outside off, solid defence from Mahmudullah

Commentary: when the ball is outside off though, he isn't quite as sure of himself. Pokes at a good length ball away from his body and is beaten

Commentary: fuller delivery on off stump, covers it well
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: back of a length and just outside off, Mahmudullah waits on it and blocks firmly
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: defends a good length ball coming in towards his off stump. Cracking sound off the bat

Commentary: goes wider of the crease to angle the back of a length delivery in at fifth stump, Mominul taps and runs into the covers

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, no need to play those
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: comes back in off the pitch,  but it does so early enough that Mahmudullah can hurry into his push through the covers. Umesh goes for a throw, off balance, but there is no one there to back up. Bangladesh take the overthrow

Commentary: India review for a leg before. First we check the no-ball, it seems tight, but Bhuvneshwar seems to be fine. Just a sliver behind the line. Then comes a fuller delivery, comes in off the pitch. Mahmudullah is deceived by that late movement, his bat hitting the pad to interfere with his strokeplay. Hits low on the pads, but this might be going down leg. Hawk-eye says it is just clipping. But middle and off stumps were visible when the batsman was playing the shot. Good indication for umpire Wilson, justifiable decision from him as well
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, drives to short cover
Commentary_short: Kumar to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: starts with a slightly shorter delivery outside off, Mominul picks the length early, rocks back, waits on it so much that he cuts out of the wicketkeeper's gloves. Beautiful shot

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Mominul is onto the back foot again and punches through cover

Commentary: defuses a length ball on middle and leg and nudges it towards square leg

Commentary: shortish and outside off, drills it into the covers

Commentary: back of a length on middle, blocks

Commentary: full and outside off, he drives to the right of cover.

Commentary: gorgeous bowling. He pitches it up, and it's just wide enough for Mahmudullah to think he has an easy cover drive. Then he is done in by the outswing, moving in the direction of the shine.

Commentary: goes short this time, Mahmudullah is waiting for it this time, hanging back and guiding the ball between second slip and gully

Commentary: slides down the leg side, Mahmudullah will be disappointed at not getting the little bat he needs to find the fine leg boundary

Commentary: into the pads again, clips it as Mahmudullah tries a flick and goes through to the wicketkeeper's left.

Commentary: good length ball outside off, Mominul goes back and blocks down the pitch

Commentary: fuller in length, but Mominul keeps going back, giving himself the liberty of reading the ball off the pitch. Blocks again

Commentary: pushes it through a little quicker on middle, Mominul nudges it to short leg

Commentary: now he is brought forward to a flighted delivery on middle, clips it to short leg

Commentary: there's nothing there, but India are appealing wildly for a caught behind. They discuss, they keep discussing, and decide not to go for the review. Beautiful delivery, tosses it up outside off, brings Mominul forward, makes him push at the ball, which doesn't turn as much as he thinks it would. Goes past the outside edge. Well, jumps, really. Loads of bounce

Commentary: loops the ball up again, bringing Mominul forward, making him hit against the turn, because the line is wide outside off. The ball dips sharply and takes the inside edge to short midwicket

Commentary: another big appeal for lbw, and umpire Wilson gives it. Mominul walks as well, so he doesn't think there is an inside edge. Umesh is on song, his length is so good this morning. Full, nipping back in off the pitch just enough to beat the bat and clang into the back pad, twice, in front of middle. That's plumb.

Dismissal_text: Mominul Haque lbw b Yadav 12 (53m 36b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

Commentary: beautiful bowling. Shakib likes feeling bat on ball early, and he drags him with a full, wide delivery, reversing away from his reach. Confounds him

Commentary: full on off stump, curls away late, Shakib is better prepared for it. Steers to point

Commentary: too high for the lbw. Could also be pitched outside leg. Shakib is caught in the crease, deer in headlights against the pace, and the fact that this ball held its line and ca,me on straight. He is waiting for the ball to move across him and so is very late in defending this back of a length straight ball

Commentary: full toss, wide outside off, lashes it over the cordon and into the boundary.

Commentary: now the bouncer on middle and leg, Shakib does well to sink under it

Commentary: goes back and flicks a shortish delivery to short midwicket

Commentary: the ball is keeping low, so playing Jadeja off the back foot is going to be diffcult. Mahmudllah just about gets bat to it

Commentary: flatter on middle and leg, whips it past Ashwin's right at short midwicket

Commentary: tosses it up onto leg stump, Mahmudullah nudges it towards backward square leg. He's worried about a little extra bounce this time

Commentary: no short leg, which is where this inside edge goes. Jadeja holds his back a bit, but disguises that by the flight he puts in. Lovely spin bowling. Mahmudullah, deceived, is forward too early, pushing at the ball

Commentary: flighted delivery on off stump, defends
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Umesh bowling around the stumps, Shakib pushes to point
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: width outside off and Shakib gets under the length ball and lifts it over point. Good shot. Puts away the bad ball, Bangladesh have to keep doing that as and when they get them

Commentary: the line changes, gets closer to off stump, forces Shakib to play with a straight bat and beats the outside edge with late movement off the pitch
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: now he does it off the full length, this is basically a 140 kph offcutter. Pitches on fourth stump, and then the ball scythes away in the direction of the shine
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: fuller ball outside off, Shakib, gingerly pushes it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: and this is when the inswing, or even the angle of the ball coming into the batsman from around the wicket works. Shakib is not ready for the 138 kph delivery as he goes for the flick very late and gets hit on the pads
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: tries to dispel the pressure by running at the bowler, Jadeja senses it and fires it through flat on middle and leg, cramping him up. Mahmudullah, panicking, tries to swing and is hit on the pad
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: tosses it up onto leg stump, Mahmudullah tries a flick but does not connect. Lucky for him, for the ball plops up to short leg
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: tosses it up on middle and leg, Mahmudullah tries to hit against the turn, along with the angle, and is beaten again. Struck on the pads, didn't straighten enough for the lbw
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: tosses it up, asking the batsman to drive, with a short cover in place. Latest trick in Jadeja;s bag. Mahmudullah though drives into the ground
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: good length ball on off stump, defends
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: fires it in on middle and off, and Mahmudullah, going back in his crease, because of the trajectory, has to shove his straight bat lower because of the lack of bounce. This is probing stuff.
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: big appeal for the lbw as Umesh finds Shakib sluggish with an inswinger. Pitches on off stump, skids into him too quickly, the batsman hurriedly flicks across the line and survives because it would have gone down
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: full and wide, Shakib manages to smack it through the covers. His feet dont necessarily move, but his hands are good enough to make a solid connection
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: fuller delivery outside off, drives into the covers
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Mahmudullah targets the gap between second slip and gully and glides it to the third man boundary
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mahmudullah, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball, coming in off the pitch and in the air. Mahmudullah blocks
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: that's well played. There is plenty of reverse on this full, nearly overpitched delivery, but he isn't fazed by it and presents the full face of the bat as he drives. Umesh saves a certain boundary and heads off for a well earned drink
Commentary_short: Yadav to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: flights the ball outside off, Shakib leans into a drive, with the angled bat and gets a couple in front of point
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

Commentary: good length ball just outside off, Shakib comes forward to block

Commentary: presses forward outside off, Shakib reaches towards the pitch of the ball and opens face
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: stays back against a good length ball, adjusts for the turn out of the rough, plays close to the boundary and steers it to point
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: drives an overpitched delivery down the ground, but Jadeja anticipates it, moves to his left quickly and stops a boundary
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: hammers it back at the bowler, Jadeja has to stick his hands up over his head and reverse cup. It's too quick even for him. Difficult to call that a drop, basically because it still retains the force to go over to the boundary
Commentary_short: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: helps a short ball on middle stump on its way to long leg. If you dig the ball into the middle of this slow pitch, it makes it easier for the batsman

Commentary: defends so late, waiting for the ball to move, and it does, into the left-hander. Tough to play out there at the moment. The movement is only minimal, but India's accuracy is making it very threatening

Commentary: races past the outside edge, as Umesh pitches a good length ball on middle, forces Shakib to defend and then, like it's on a string, darts it away to the wicketkeeper

Commentary: full and wide, Shakib drives into the covers
Commentary_short: Yadav to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: this is an indipper, pitching on off stump, full as well, so it gives Shakib very little time to adjust. Manages an inside edge onto pad. At Umesh's pace, this is hard work

The orthodox left-arm spinner, meant to spin into Shakib just holds its line and with him lunging forward to the tossed up ball, playing for turn, the outcome is pretty basic.

Commentary: 137 kph, and now it's Ishant's turn to exploit the old ball. Back of a length, cuts into the right-hander, in the direction of the shine. Mahmudullah tries to slice it through point but misses

This is a good length ball, seaming in off the pitch, and that leaves the batsman defending down the wrong line. He's hit on the top of the back pad, that leg is bent a bit. HawkEye shows it is clipping leg stump and the decision from umpire Wilson stands

Commentary: full and slings it down leg, Mushfiqur nudges it to short midwicket

Commentary: hits the back leg, going for an lbw call and India review. Gorgeous delivery to start. This is on a good length, angled into the middle and leg stump. Shakib plays that angle, and is defeated by the turn. Ashwin says, I'm sure there is no bat, to further the review. Confirmation arrives. But the ball passes off stump, on height too. Excellent call from umpire Erasmus. No more reviews for India

Commentary: tosses it up on off stump, drives to short cover

Commentary: leans into a good length ball and drills it past Kohli's left at short cover. Damn the inswing he says with that strong shot

Commentary: moves to fifty with a risky boundary through cover, it's his highest score against India too. Sees the flight on the ball and hares down the track. Commentary: comes down the track, drives to mid-off and knows there is a single. Mushfiqur though is less certain, he is sluggish and that's a bad place to be with Jadeja being the fielder. This is very close, despite the dive, because the bat thuds into the ground and jumps up in the air. That doesn't happen if you slide the bat with the face downward. He dives and the bat makes contact with the ground on the side of the edge and so it pops up. The third umpire has a big decision to make, because the shoulder of the bat is close to the line, on the line, when the right bail pop up. But it's difficult to be absolutely sure about whether the bat is inside or on the line. And the third umpire Gaffaney gives the benefit of the doubt to the batsman
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

Commentary: another confusion and it's Mushfiqur again, this time going for an optimistic third run. It's a fuller delivery, outside off, Shakib leans into the drive and places it past Jadeja at mid-off. He hunts the ball down, and throws at the keeper's end, seeing Mushfiqur take off, not knowing Shakib would say no. So in the end, by the time Saha collects the ball and relays it back to the bowler, the Bangladesh captain is safe

Commentary: this has been happening way too often with Shakib. He gets set. He looks to dominate, then he plays a poor shot. A low percentage shot. Comes down the track, doesn't reach the pitch, still goes for the loft, against the turn, mis-hits to mid-on. The exactly way he fell on a crucial final day's play in New Zealand when they were desperately trying to survive and hold on for a draw. And Ashwin has his wicket, doing very little other than being persistent and waiting for the batsman to make the mistake

Commentary: big big appeal. No, says umpire Joel Wilson. Was it caught? Kohli had taken that. Kohli reviews. Flat on off and middle, Tamin gets right forward and inside-edges the ball into his front pad. The ball then lobs up towards Kohli at gully, who takes the ball and appeals. The umpire will have to overturn his decision. Some have been turning, some haven't in this innings already. That one didn't. Kohli was particularly adamant that the batsman had hit that, asked Saha for confirmation and went for the review. Good assertive captaincy.
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

India's appeal is quickly shot down by umpire Wilson but Kohli chooses to go for the review. Umpire Erasmus asks for the stumping too. That's not out either. So, all good eventually. The bat was a long way from the pad

He floats it up on leg stump, and Mominul's short stride finds him a long way from the pitch of a ball that turns sharply, and his attempt at a defensive push results in an outside edge and another catch for Rahane at slip

Smart catch as well, from Pujara

Commentary: this straightens off the pitch and Mahmudullah only cottons onto it at the very last possible moment. Beautiful bowling from Ishant. It's the length - always full, denying the batsman the time he needs to read the way the ball moves.

Commentary: fuller and outside off, swinging into him in the air, defends to point

Commentary: ball pitching outside leg, meet front pad.

Commentary: good length ball on off stump, blocks

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Mushfiqur ignores it

Commentary: now on the other side, looking to hit some of the close-in fielders out of his space. Runs down the track, again he preempts the line of the ball to be outside leg and hits through the line.

Commentary: the bowler pulls his length back, Mahmudullah is waiting for this too, and is able to retain strike with a flick to midwicket. That's drinks

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah refuses to play

Commentary: there's an inside edge, and India accept umpire Wilson's call, don't go for the review. This is the ball Jadeja bowls overs and overs to set up. Commentary: gorgeous batting. Bangladesh do not want Ashwin to settle, and they know there is very little rough outside off stump. So Mushfiqur comes down the track and gleefully hits against the turn through cover. He can do that without any risk, considering he got to the pitch of the ball

Commentary: good length ball on off stump, defends

Commentary: that's one shot too much. Ashwin has sensed that the batsman wants to attack him, so he pulls the length back just enough. Disguises it though, by ensuring it is still a tossed up delivery. Mushfiqur rushes down the track, doesn't get to the pitch, still backs himself to clear mid-off, but mistimes his shot badly. Easy catch to the fielder running back and Ashwin celebrates by waving both his hands in the air to soak in the applause from the school kids
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Mushfiqur Rahim, OUT
Dismissal_text: Mushfiqur Rahim c Jadeja b Ashwin 23 (65m 44b 2x4 1x6) SR: 52.27

Took a fantastic catch like that on the last day of the Chennai Test against England

Should he have been playing back? Well, considering the ball didn't rise as much as he thought, he couldn't have done much with it

Commentary: found long leg with a top-edged pull. What's with Ishant and short balls? This originally doesn't look threatening, which is why Mahmudullah sets up for the pull, but then it climbs on him, cramps him for room, and so he mistimes the shot. Who knew it'd be the quicks doing the damage on the last day of a Hyderabad Test?

Commentary: tosses it up, massively, and Taskin tries to flick, seems to miss the ball and opens himself up for an lbw appeal. Umpire Erasmus says wait, and then goes to check with his partner. Finally, he tags in the third umpire, and the soft signal is out. No bat there, so the catch should go out the window. They don't check the lbw though, not out flashes on the screen. But wait, Kohli has reviewed for lbw. So two reviews for the same ball. Pitched in line with leg, straightens enough to hit the front pad in line, and crashes into the stumps too. Three reds. India win
Commentary_short: Ashwin to Taskin Ahmed, OUT
Dismissal_text: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Ashwin 1 (10m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 14.28
